intro: Euphrasia monroi, commonly known as the purple-eyed violet, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, violet-colored flowers with prominent, dark purple eyespots. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia monroi typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in partial to full shade.
